SEARCH
Package data_managers

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
data_managers.UserManager
public class UserManager extends Object
The UserManager class takes care of interacting with the file where the users are stored. It performs writing, updating, reading and searching in the users' storage.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserManager

      public UserManager()

  • Method Details

    • readUsers

      public static ArrayList<User> readUsers()
      The readUsers function reads all users records from the users' storage.
      Returns:
      An array list of the users records from the storage. Empty array list if not any.

    • writeUser

      public static void writeUser(User user)
      The writeUser function adds a user record to the users' storage.
      Parameters:
      user - The user record to be written in the storage.

    • ifUserExists

      public static boolean ifUserExists(User user)
      The ifUserExists function checks if the user exists in the users' storage.
      Parameters:
      user - The user record to be checked if exists in the storage.
      Returns:
      true if the user record exists. false if it does not.

    • getUser

      public static User getUser(String username)
      The getUser function searches for a user with the same username in the storage and provides their record.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user that we search
      Returns:
      The record of the user with the same username. null if a user with this title does not exist.

    • updateUser

      public static boolean updateUser(User user)
      The updateUser function searches if the provided user record exists and if so updates their entry.
      Parameters:
      user - The user record to be updated in the storage.
      Returns:
      true if the user record is updated successfully. false if updating failed.

    • checkCredentials

      public static User checkCredentials(String username, String password)
      The checkCredentials function checks if there exists a user account with the given username/email and password.
      Parameters:
      username - Either the username or the email with which the user tries to log in.
      password - The password of the user trying to log in.
      Returns:
      The user record if there exists one with the corresponding email and password. null if it doesn't exist.
